title: In an examination, 49.3% of the total students appeared passed successfully. If the number of successful candidates is 23,128, how many students appeared in the exam? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends….! In an examination, 49.3% of the total students appeared passed successfully. If the number of successful candidates is 23,128, how many students appeared in the exam? Let there be x number of students appeared in the examination. Total students appeared passed successfully = 49.3% Thus 49.3% of total students = 49.3x/100 Their number is 23128. Accordingly 49.3x/100 = 23128 Cross multiplication 49.3x = 23128 × 100 x = 2312800/49.3 x = 46913 The total number of students appeared in the examination was 46913. Answer The total number of students appeared in the examination was 46913.
